result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody R. Hamann-Weide was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: --to undergo AODA assessment treatment and follow through

--to undergo any other assessment treatment and follow through as the Agent may independently determine Mr. Hamann-Weide needs.  The Court orders that Mr. Hamann-Weide be evaluated in a psycho-sexual evaluation 
--to undergo mental healthcare treatment;  to be evaluated for mental healthcare issues

--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances except those that are by prescription, and Mr. Hamann-Weide is to take those prescription drugs only as prescribed by a treating physician
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores

--to be subject to urinalyses for drugs and alcohol

The Court requires Mr. Hamann-Weide to report to the Probation Office in Jefferson tomorrow. 
Counsel indicate that all court financial obligations have been paid in full.

**Days credit for time already served given as to Count #2 (in the event that this Probation is revoked):  43 days**

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
--serve six months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for treatment and work; to commence forthwith 

--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

--78 days credit for time already served given.

12/5/17: Sentencing After Revocation- Defendant placed on probation on Count #2
04/03/17: Sentencing After Defendant Self Revoked.

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 9:03am. 
Defendant Cody R. Hamann-Weide in court, in custody, with Attorney Michael C. Witt.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Probation Agent Stacey Bieberitz is present.
Sentencing argument given by ADA Teuber. 
 
On Count #2 the Court sentences Mr. Hamann-Weide to:
--serve six months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for treatment and work; to commence forthwith 
--78 days credit for time already served given.
Agent Bieberitz confirms that all court financial obligations have been paid. 
recess 9:10am
Duplicate Copy of the 3/29/18 Letter from DOC Agent
Letter from DOC
Sentencing hearing on April 3, 2018 at 09:00 am.

(SF) Case called at 10:34 am
Defendant Cody R. Hamann-Weide in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt and Attorney Joel Witt. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Tammy Capute and Brian Dyskra Department of Corrections Field Supervisor from the local Jefferson Office along with Ashley Melanson from Department 

Attorney Witt reviews that the math doesn't add up for him to stay on probation.
Attorney Witt advises that the Agent told the Defendant to Petition the Court to Self Revoke.

Court reviews that it wants the Department of Corrections input 
ADA Teuber advises the she believes that the Defendant is able to self revoke.
Court inquires if a revocation report is needed.
ADA Teuber informs the Court that she has not researched that topic.

Court reviews the Gallion Factors and letters from DOC.
Court indicates that it wants a report from DOC how the Defendant did on probation.
Attorney Witt points to letter from DOC Agent where Agent talks about how Defendant was doing, so believes that the Court could use that and go ahead today.
Attorney Witt reviews the history of the case.

ADA Teuber has confirmed through the Department of Corrections the defendant can self revoke, and while they are not required to submit a report they are willing to create a report but request to have until friday to submit that to the Court.
ADA Teuber will provide the total credit that the State and Attorney Witt agreed upon to the Department to review.
Attorney Witt informs the Court that if there is a delay he is out after next Tuesday he wouldn't be able to get back into here based on his calendar until mid April.
ADA Teuber advises that the Department of Correction still has to review credit and they request until friday to submit their report.

recess: 10:55 am
NEXT: Resentencing Hearing on 4/3/18 at 9:00 am

Count #2

[MK] case called at 4:06pm. 
Defendant Cody R. Hamann-Weide in court, in custody, with Attorney Michael C. Witt.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance. 
Sentencing arguments are given by counsel.

On Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Hamann-Weide to:
--serve 8 months in Jefferson County Jail; to commence forthwith [time served] 
--Credit for time already served that is applied to this Count #1 jail term:  180 days 

On Count #2 the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Hamann-Weide on Probation for one year with conditions: 
--to undergo AODA assessment treatment and follow through
--to undergo any other assessment treatment and follow thorugh as the Agent may independently determine Mr. Hamann-Weide needs.  The Court orders that Mr. Hamann-Weide be evaluated in a psycho-sexual evaluation 
--to be subject to urinalyses for drugs and alcohol
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances except those that are by prescription, and Mr. Hamann-Weide is to take those prescription drugs only as prescribed by a treating physician
--to undergo mental healthcare treatment;  to be evaluated for mental healthcare issues
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores

The Court requires Mr. Hamann-Weide to report to the Probation Office in Jefferson tomorrow. 
Days credit for time already served given as to Count #2 (in the event that this Probation is revoked):  43 days 
Counsel indicate that all court financial obligations have been paid in full.
recess 4:25pm.
Electronic filing registration confirmation put into Attorny Witt's mail box in Clerk of Courts office (MG 12-4-17)
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 5, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Case called at 9:22 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Cody R. Hamann-Weide in court, in-custody, on Huber, with Attorney Michael C. Witt. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Hamnn-Weide waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information; Arraignment:--service of Information admitted, reading waived
ADA Teuber submits victim impact statement

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Counts #1 & #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #3

On Counts #1 & #2, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--serve 60 days in Jefferson County Jail (count 1 only), with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence 8/24/15 at 1:00 am 
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--Random drug screening 
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--To pay costs of $486 ($243 each count)
--To pay $400 DNA Surcharge ($200 each count)

Days credit for time already served: 1 day
Court charges Atty Witt to inform Probation of new case

Cases 14CF140 and 15CF82 called together at 8:35 am [mo]
Defendant Cody R. Hamann-Weide in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 14CF140:
The Court and Counsel discuss the Deferred Prosecution Agreement, specifically the revocation/ termination of the agreement. 
The Court acknowledges receipt of the Therapy Progress Report submitted by the Defense.
---The Court reviews the Report
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance; and notifies the Court that she will be making statements on behalf of the victim/victim's family

Sentencing arguments given by ADA Teuber
Sentencing arguments given by Atty. Witt

On Counts #1, #2 and #3, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years on each count concurrent, with conditions:

--On Count #1 to serve 90 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on  5/26/15 at   7:00pm.
---Mr. Hamann-Weide is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--No Contact with M.R.L. (DOB: 9/30/2001)
--to undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--On Count #1 to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge

--On Count #2 to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #3 to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge

The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for expungement on the case.

Atty. Witt requests the Therapy Progress Report be sealed in the court file based on the sensitive nature of the report and victim information
The Court orders The Therapy Progress Report is to be sealed in the file. 


In Case 14CF140: Days credit for time already served:  1 day

As to Case 15CF82:
Atty. Witt requests a status conference date
No objection from the state
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling 
The Court reminds Mr. Hamann- Weide that his bond and its conditions in this file remain in effect
